Message.Title: NTWK $5.5 UP 15c....UP AGAIN AFTER MONESTER EARNINGS AND 40% REVENUE GROWTH & $1/SHARE 2013 GUIDANCE...PRICE TARGET RAISED TO $16......NTWK .has been up every day after a minor post-record earnings profit taking. The stock is just starting to rally and with a 3 million share float $15 soon is just around the corner (see chart). That would make it a 12 forward PE which is conservative for a company expecting to deliver $1/share net income and grow revenues 40% in 2013.........still very cheap even at $15
Message.Msg: SHORT TERM TARGET $10+ .......2013 GUIDANCE: 40% GROWTH AND $1/SHARE NET INCOME NTWK'S OTHER CLOUD DIVISION VROOZI ALREADY EXPLODED IN REVENUES IN Q4 2012.....POTENTIAL ACQUISITION TARGET WITH CLOSE TIES TO SAP 3M SHARE FLOAT......AFTER EARNINGS PROFIT TAKING OVER.....MAGNIFICENT CHART In addition to legacy license-based products gaining strong momentum, the company's cloud divisions are starting to show significant growth as well. The company's Cloud division Vroozi is growing exponentially NTWK announced a new North America cloud business unit last week. Larger companies are swallowing fast growing enterprise cloud providers with SAP and ORCL certification and compatibility. "We made a calculated decision to enter this growing market given our years of experience as a software developer, the minimal investment required, and the revenue potential given just the breadth of our current relationships," said Najeeb Ghauri, chairman and CEO of NetSol. "I am fully confident in our highly capable team, reinforced by our talented group of IT professionals, to scale the business quickly and capture a portion of this burgeoning industry, creating an additional revenue driver and further diversifying our revenue mix by geography." "What we are offering, in essence, is private cloud performance at an elastic cloud price -- giving potential customers in our target market segment the performance, flexibility, reliability, and a no-nonsense fixed pricing model that they have long desired," added Imran Haider, COO of NetSol North America and head of NetSolCloudVM. "As a growing software company ourselves, we have critical insights into the efficiency and productivity needs of NetSolCloudVM's target customer base and look forward to unveiling our new services in the coming months." In its updated public cloud forecast in June, Gartner estimated that IaaS was the fastest growing cloud segment with a projected GAGR of 41.7%, and exceeding a $20 billion global market by 2016. ===== 4Q and FY 2012 EARNINGS SUMMARY......9/4/2012 NetSol Technologies Reported RECORD Fiscal Fourth Quarter and Year-End Results - 9/4/2012 - Fourth Quarter 2012 Revenue Surges to an all-time quarterly record of $14.3 Million on Increased License Revenues and associated maintenance and service agreements going forward - Fourth Quarter 2012 Earnings Advance Significantly to $0.25 per Diluted Share - Full Year 2012 revenues a record $38M - Full Year 2012 Earnings of $0.39/share - Company Expects Record Fiscal 2013 Annual Revenue Growing over 30% to $46 million to $49 million, With Earnings per Diluted Share Advancing to $0.80 to $1.00 - Per the CC, Company anticipates doubling revenues and net income by 2015 NTWK HIGHLIGHTS: - Only 3 million share float - Fast growing profitable US-based global cloud and license-based software company with 8 offices worldwide (US, China, Australia, UK, Pakistan, Singapore, Thailand, Saudi Arabia) – - Trading at 5 PE and 1 times sales – This is about 25% of sector average - Revenues are increasing at double digit rates, - Guidance calls for 30% revenue growth in 2013 - 3 consecutive quarters of profitability, - Guidance calls for $1/share net income in 2013!!! - Global alliances with Mercedes Benz and SANY Corp of China. - No. 1 in China and the APAC region in its niche market of leasing and financing software - It’s Vroozi Division is a fast growing Cloud Computing Play with strong relations with SAP, ORCL, MSFT. - Vroozi’s SAP-approved smartOCI procurement search catalog software built on SaaS is being adopted rapidly. Revenues exploded in 4Q 2012 and are expected to multiply in 2013 and a big reason for the 30%+ 2013 projected revenue increase - Vroozi has been created as independent entity to potentially IPO it or sell it to a cloud-acquiring giant like SAP and others - Strong balance sheet with $1/share Cash - With every license they sell a lucrative 5-year service and maintenance agreement building strong recurrent revenues - Huge and consistent insider buying. Insiders bought over 5% of the outstanding shares since 2010 - Strong institutional investor support grew to almost 20% from 11% last year - NTWK has over 50 Fortune 100 loyal customers. Never lost a customer. None of the customers is over 5% of the total revenues - partial customer list: CitiGroup, Mercedes Benz, Santander, BMW, Volvo, Ford, GE Capital, Cisco Capital, Paribas, GMAC, Toyota, Nissan, Hyundai, BYD, SANY Corp. China, etc.process of testing our new message boards. Please provide your feedback so that we can optimize the user experience

Message.Title: What should Yahoo do? Comment on my list and add your own ideas
Message.Msg: Assuming Yahoo! finalizes its first two Asian deals and has access to a net of 12B (including existing cash and current funds) by November as many hope. What will they do? Here are some of the options that I see: 1. Use funds to restructure for new growth by buying start-up companies with synergies to existing and developing Yahoo IP? [may take years for significant return on investment but could make Yahoo! relevant for many years to come] 2. Position themselves for a cash rich purchased by another company - for example Apple or Microsoft. The cash would be a bonus and could be used to leverage the value of that company buying a third company. For instance apple could gain significantly by purchasing both Yahoo (eyes, content, and IP) and Nuance (voice, IP) to go along with their push towards voice and content. 12B in cash would make a leveraged deal, say for 26B for Yahoo, easy to do at a net cost of16B and they could partition off the remaining 20% of Alibaba (selling it for 7-8B and bringing the cost down to 6-7B) or use it to develop Asian wing of franchise. 3. Buy back shares to bring float down to 1B, or even 0.8B, and spend the rest on buying IP from strategic start-ups or small companies. [may take 2-5 years for a significant return on investment] 4. Buy a large company using most of the money and set up an alliance with a third company like Apple, microsoft, google, or IBM...that might otherwise have SEC problems in closing a purchased deal themselves. [could result in immediate return on investment - particularly with a good contract with a third party] 5. Pay out the bulk of the money to shareholders, with an expected proportional decrease in share price [I have a hard time coming up with any positives on this other than some cash in the shareholder's pocket which they can use to invest in anything]. These are just a few possibilities. I don't know what they have in mind - What do you think?

Topic.Title: What should Yahoo do? Comment on my list and add your own ideas

Message.Msg: "Please state what you believe Yahoo! Inc. is." Yahoo is a stock where professional investors go to destroy their careers. Or It is a fantasy where investors go to have their hopes and dreams crushed. In either case Yahoo is a DREAMLAND best described by Poe. "By a route obscure and lonely, Haunted by ill angels only, Where an Eidolon named NIGHT, On a black thrown reigns upright, I have reached these lands but newly, From an ultimate dim Thule - From a wild weird clime that lieth, sublime, Out of Space and Out of Time."

Topic.Title: What should Yahoo do? Comment on my list and add your own ideas

Message.Msg: FYI - Yahoo! Discusses what they believe they are on their corporate website. "Our vision is to deliver your world, your way. We do that by using technology, insights, and intuition to create deeply personal digital experiences that keep more than half a billion people connected to what matters the most to them – across devices, on every continent, in more than 30 languages. And we connect advertisers to the consumers who matter to them most – the ones who will build their businesses – through our unique combination of Science + Art + Scale. " ...... "Today, Yahoo! stands out as one of the most visited and most trusted Internet destinations because we uniquely pair innovative technology with a human touch to personalize the digital world. Our business focuses on creating a content, communications, and community platform that delivers rich consumer experiences and advertising solutions across the screens of people’s lives — from desktops to mobile devices, from tablets to connected TVs. Yahoo! is headquartered in Sunnyvale, Calif., and has more than 12,000 employees in 25 countries, provinces, and territories." IMO the parameters provide for creativity and change and I am hoping to see both!!! Unfortunately, this creative framework leaves boundaries unclear and without strong leadership such ideals can be hard to achieve. I hope they now have strong leadership...but, like everyone else, I am waiting for Yahoo! to define its direction(s).

Topic.Title: What should Yahoo do? Comment on my list and add your own ideas

Message.Msg: Yahoo! Inc. as well as all the other Yahoo entities is first and foremost an advertising effort. Since the begining Yahoo has derived the bulk of it's revenue from advertising. The content displayed and search engine are bait to lure the user to the site only. Once the user is on the site then it is Yahoo's effort / hope that the user will find ads display on the many web pages that exist on Yahoo appealing or interesting enought to entice the user "to click on" the ad thereby generating revenue. Yahoo! Inc. is a billboard and or a show case and little more. Thankfully Mr. Yang made the investment with Mr. Ma. Without that event taking place Yahoo! Inc. would be what? A major obsticle for Yahoo! Inc. is that in the past Yahoo has been free to the user and supported by the revenues derived from online advertising. To change that format is very difficult as Yahoo Inc. offers little that it can charge the user for that is not available somewhere else for free. So to accurately dscribe Yahoo! Inc. one would need to answer that it is indeed an advertising company that had a foundr that made a wise investment choice. Arguments?

Message.Title: Technical reversal signal on the P&F chart.
Message.Msg: $19.51 intraday print just fired the reversal. While this is not yet a buy signal, we just doubled our small long position on the retrace to the 38.2% fib at $19.42. Technically, this could portend what could be either a breakout or at least an oversold bounce. A retrace to $17.99 as low as $17.50 intraday, then back to $20.01 intraday would fire the very first buy signal on $FB, a double top breakout, and switch the bias to bullish. Alternatively the oversold bounce on this swing would fire a buy at $25.01 on the classic P&F chart.

Topic.Title: Alibaba's transaction Value more than AMZN & EBAY

Message.Msg: Is that true? Alibaba strikes me as a site that with ordinary rules would be banned from many search engine tracking. They have the dictionary for keywords, when META keywords are supposedly ignored or are passe, they often don't actually have what one is looking for, they provide links to many other sites, often in China or otherwise outside the US, and especially in the product line I am most interested in, are intrusive, showing up on many pages (there's a trick I'd like to learn).

Topic.Title: Technical reversal signal on the P&F chart.

Message.Msg: Shorts are getting crushed, and the squeeze is on. Doesn't count for the P&F, but the AH cut above $20 certainly sets the prob of an intraday at $20.01 and higher. A $20.01 intraday on 9/12 allows for more breathing room in the bottoming process to a classic buy signal, as it permits a basing to $18.49 to $18, with a double top breakout buy at $20.51. Or of course it brings us just that much closer to the oversold bounce buy point.
